CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant and his wife obtained an occupation certificate for a municipal flat where another family , ( “ Family X ” ) , lived at the material time . Family X had , in turn , received an occupation certificate for another flat . As the flat offered to Family X did not meet their expectations , the family refused to move out of the old flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG of GPE seeking the eviction of Family X.
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE , who owned the flat at the material time , also lodged a claim for the eviction of Family X.

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in the absence of the defendants passed judgment in default , granting the applicant ’s request and ordering the eviction of Family X. However , the latter appealed against the above judgment which was annulled as a result on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defendants lodged a counter claim , requesting , inter alia , that the applicant ’s occupation certificate be declared void .
CARDINAL . Meanwhile , in DATE the applicant and his wife privatised the flat in dispute and registered their property right in ORG .

CARDINAL . As regards the QUANTITY hearings fixed DATE and DATE , CARDINAL were adjourned following requests by the defendants and CARDINAL were adjourned because the representative of ORG of GPE failed to attend . The remaining CARDINAL hearings were adjourned in view of the non - attendance of ORG , which was responsible for the allocation of municipal housing to the defendants and whose attendance was required to verify the issue of the lawfulness of the provision to the defendants’ family of new housing and the taking away of the flat in dispute . It was not until ORG imposed a fine on ORG amounting to MONEY for non - attendance at the hearings that a representative of the ORG finally appeared before the court .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the ORG of GPE granted the applicant ’s claim and dismissed that of the defendant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment was upheld on appeal by ORG and entered into force .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiffs opened enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the enforcement proceedings were suspended until DATE and DATE respectively , pending the examination of the request filed by the defendants for supervisory review of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE , as upheld on appeal on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were again suspended following the subsequent request from the defendants for supervisory review of the above judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy President of ORG of GPE brought an application for supervisory review of the judgment to the Presidium of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG quashed the judgment by way of supervisory review and remitted the case for fresh examination by a differently composed bench .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG granted the GPE counter claim and declared the occupation certificate issued to the applicant void . The court further obliged ORG of GPE to provide the applicant and his family with another flat .
CARDINAL . Following the appeal lodged against the above judgment by ORG of GPE , on DATE the ORG quashed the above judgment on appeal and remitted the case for fresh examination .

CARDINAL . As regards the CARDINAL hearings fixed between CARDINAL DATE and DATE , CARDINAL was adjourned because the judge was involved in another case , CARDINAL were adjourned because of the non - attendance of the defendants and on their request , and CARDINAL were adjourned because of the non - attendance of ORG of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG granted the applicant ’s claim and dismissed that of the defendants .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment on appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiffs opened the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defendants were evicted . The applicant and his family moved into the flat .
